content.title: Torno Subito, Italy under the Emirati sun

introduction.small: 1960s Italy under the Dubai sun, a tasteful adventure and an invitation to let go… Enjoy the moment at Torno Subito.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Torno Subito, Italy under the Emirati sun

paragraphs.text:
Having proved himself to his peers with his 3-star Osteria Francescana in Modena – considered to be nothing less than the best restaurant in the world – tremendously famous chef Massimo Bottura set off on a new adventure: recreating the Italian Riviera of the 1960s next to the waves of the Persian Gulf. Amid the W Dubai – The Palm, Torno Subito (“I'll be right back” in Italian) thus offers a frivolous and yet sophisticated concept, stripping down the ageing artefacts inherited from Old Europe.

On the menu, Margherita pizza, or a sweet and crescent-shaped one (a reference to the geographic location of the restaurant) with chocolate, almonds, nuts and honey, as well as tagliatelle al ragú with a turkey base or a langoustine risotto.

Taking its cue from the requirements of Hedonist patrons, the experience of a traditional restaurant is adapted upon request to paddle boats (for up to four people) carrying a picnic luxury basket. You probably did not see that coming!

Torno Subito Dubai
W Dubai – The Palm
West Crescent
Palm Jumeirah
P.O. Box 117992, Dubai

+971 (0)4 245 5555

https://www.tornosubitodubai.com/

Menu: from 230 AED

content.title: Sea view and a twist on Indian gastronomy at Masti

introduction.small: The new and trendy La Mer district in Dubai adds a restaurant to its roster: Masti modernises Indian cuisine in a colourful and hip setting.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Sea view and a twist on Indian gastronomy at Masti

paragraphs.text:
With royal blue bench seats, braided cushions and vintage toad armchair, a bar with flower motif and coloured stained-glass, Masti's universe is a perfect fit for social network enthusiasts. Spread over two floors, this modern and trendy canteen overlooks the sea. On the tables, dishes inspired by Indian gastronomy pile up in a spirit of sharing in keeping with the trend of tapas eating. The age-old recipes inherited from the Indian subcontinent are revisited with a modern twist, and sometimes even a slight touch of molecular gastronomy. Comfortably seating on the wooden terrace, with Dubai's skyline in the background, order a few shrimp served with sundried tomatoes, lentils, spicy beetroot croquettes and kale chips. Unless you would rather opt for the traditional biryani with yet another twist. After dinner, the night goes on in the lounge area, where you will find a large collection of gins. Then, you will grasp why the Hindi word “masti” means “bag of tricks”.

Masti
La Mer
Dubai

+971 (0)4 344 4384

https://www.mastidubai.com/

Menu: around 225 AED

content.title: Alici, the open sea in a plate

introduction.small: Thousands of miles away from Italy, a piece of the Amalfi Coast took up residence in Dubai, bringing its gastronomic heritage along.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Alici, the open sea in a plate

paragraphs.text:
With oil paintings and old Italian postcards on display everywhere, small white and blue bowls of olives at the centre of each table and lemon trees in the dining room, everything would lead you to believe that Alici is one of those typical seaside restaurants of the Amalfi Coast, in the South of Italy. And yet, it is not the Tyrrhenian Sea but the Dubai Marina that spreads before your eyes. On Bluewaters Island, the establishment offers Italian gastronomy, mainly based on fish and seafood. Start with arancini al ragù di mare, Sicilian rice and tomato deep fried balls, stuffed here with seafood stew. Carry on with oven-cooked halibut served with scallops, mussels and a Mediterranean fish stew. Comes dessert, indulge in a torta caprese, a chocolate cake with white chocolate cream, to enjoy on the terrace facing Dubai's skyline.

Alici
Bluewaters Island
P.O. Box 72198, Dubai

+971 4 275 2577

http://alici.com

Menu: around 285 AED

content.title: Toro + Ko, luxury tapas

introduction.small: At Toro + Ko, the convivial pleasures of Catalan gastronomy take over Dubai for an experience of sharing under the sign of excellence.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Toro + Ko, luxury tapas

paragraphs.text:
With successful experiences in Boston, New York and Bangkok, the duo of chefs Ken Oringer and Jamie Bissonnette opened a fourth restaurant in Dubai. The concept remains similar: serving Barcelona-style tapas and other dishes-to-be-shared, in a lively and welcoming atmosphere. Their use of Catalan and seasonal products, prepared with an extremely high level of requirement, makes all the difference. Wherever you choose to sit, the modern, colourful and industrial decor sets the tone: in the large dining room near the kitchen, at the cocktail bar or on the first floor, near the turntables of DJs in residence.

Before you can experience surprising flavours, you will most probably salivate watching (and smelling) the steaming hot dishes being served around you. All you need to do is choose from the menu: pinxtos, cold cuts, cheeses, hot and uncooked tapas, various meats… The patatas bravas are excellent and the paella is probably the best in all Dubai.

Toro + Ko
The Square, City Walk 2
Dubai

+971 (0)4 590 5433

https://torodubai.com

Menu: from 134 AED

content.title: Mandarin Oriental Jumeira, a shining gem

introduction.small: Between the beach and the city, you will not have to choose any longer: Mandarin Oriental Jumeira delivers 5-star services for the most relaxed of your stays.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Mandarin Oriental Jumeira, a shining gem

paragraphs.text:
Wherever you look, the view will be dazzling: on one side, Dubai's skyline, and on the other the horizon line far beyond the seafront. In Jumeira's historic neighbourhood, the “Beverly Hills” of the Emirati capital, the establishment shines through. Bronze and crystal are reflected in the ponds of the huge lobby that offers unobstructed views of the ocean. The large rooms have been decorated with pared-down refinement and open onto balconies that extend further your sense of infinite freedom. Precious materials (marble in the bathrooms, velvet and nacre in common areas) ring in the right note. Truly worthy of a 5 star!

With five swimming pools, including one on the rooftop, private beach access, a Spa and the Tasca restaurant led by starred-chef José Avillez, the Mandarin will be an ideal starting point for all your adventures in Dubai.

Mandarin Oriental Jumeira
Jumeira Beach Road
Jumeira 1
P.O. Box 62092, Dubai

+971 (0)4 777 2222

https://www.mandarinoriental.com/dubai/jumeira-beach/luxury-hotel

Rooms: from 1,050 AED

content.title: Tom and Serg, coffee kings

introduction.small: After its opening went viral, this hipster lair now ranges among the major key players of the Al Quoz neighbourhood.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Tom and Serg, coffee kings

paragraphs.text:
The place is quite surprising: a gigantic loft with exposed ducts and waxed concrete floors, very reminiscent of Brooklyn or Shoreditch. But no, you are without doubt in Dubai, in the Al Quoz industrial district to be exact, slowly but surely transforming into the capital's trendiest neighbourhood. Originally from Australia and Spain respectively, Tom Arnel and Sergio Lopez have teamed up to create this astonishing place. If the coffee is king, you will also find various other fresh and seasonal products for which some locals do not hesitate driving some distance.
If you come to Tom & Serg for breakfast, the dragon fruit acai bowl with coconut and banana yoghurt combo served with French toast in salted butter caramel and Turkish poached eggs will fill you with joy. In case of a bigger appetite during the day, a falafel salad, a satay grilled chicken served with sweet potato fries or even the gnocchi with dried tomatoes are the best answers. For those who wish something else than coffee, no problem, as they will have their pick between freshly squeezed juices ranging from watermelon to pomegranate, apple, strawberry, lime and cucumber… Fresh and tasty!

Tom & Serg
15A Street, Al-Joud Center
Al Quoz
Dubai

+971 (0)56 474 6812

www.tomandserg.com

Menu: from 95 AED

content.title: Flamingo Room by Tasha, a charming break

introduction.small: In the heart of Dubai, the Flamingo Room restaurant radiates a deliciously glamourous and chic atmosphere.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Flamingo Room by Tasha, a charming break

paragraphs.text:
Obligatory stop of trendy Dubai, the Flamingo Room is the latest spot conceived by Natasha Sideris, also known as "Tasha", the South African gastronomy superstar. It is ideally situated in the garden of the five-star Al Naseem hotel, and run by the woman herself.
Made of a double indoor dining room and a dinner bar terrace perched on a small lagoon, the restaurant harks back to the 1950s with lacquered walls and ochre velvet armchairs, and offers high-end cuisine mixing South African and Eastern influences.
The establishment welcomes its clientele 24/7, as you will be able to enjoy exquisite truffle and parmesan scrambled eggs for breakfast, get tempted by a butternut carpaccio, some vol-au-vent shrimp and lobster, or the steak served with cauliflower and truffle mash later on during the day. As for dinner, you will have an abundance of choices among cheeseburgers, pasta dishes and seafood.
The drinks menu is just as spectacular: opt for the Zoolander, a rum, banana, vermouth, orange juice and lemon tribute to Ben Stiller's “ridiculously good-looking” movie character. Love at first taste guaranteed!

Flamingo Room by Tasha
Al Naseem
Madinat Jumeirah Road, 75157
Dubai

+971 (0)4 244 7278

https://www.flamingoroombytashas.com/

Menu: from 254 AED

content.title: Gourmet break on a traditional dhow

introduction.small: In the silence of the night, a few traditional Arab sailboats called dhows, are carried along the current of the Khor Dubai River. Tonight, get on board for a gourmet cruise.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Gourmet break on a traditional dhow

paragraphs.text:
Dubai knows how to be romantic. As the sun dives into the clear waters of the Persian Gulf, the city settles down and invites you to one of its exceptional dinner cruises. Aboard these Arab boats, a sumptuous dinner will be served as you are rocked by the gentle surf of the clear river that runs through the city.

The metropolis then reveals another, more mysterious face. No longer indulging in excessiveness and delusions of grandeur, you are now abandoned to the serenity of an enlightened evening and a hypnotic spectacle. As you watch the island's buildings and skyscrapers in the early evening light, you can enjoy the country's renowned hospitality over a meal prepared by chefs from five-star establishments. You may come across small ships ready to brave the open sea, and many yachts belonging to the wealthy vacationers of the island. Time stands still, enjoy!

Rustar Floating Restaurant
Banyas Road
Opp Rolex Tower, Dubai Creek
Dubai

+971 (0)4 395 7941

https://rustarcruise.com/

From: 320 AED per person (cruise + dinner)

content.title: The Orient Guest House, a leap back in time in Dubai

introduction.small: In the heart of the city, the Orient Guest House welcomes you in a quiet villa, far from the glass-walled skyscrapers.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: The Orient Guest House, a leap back in time in Dubai

paragraphs.text:
Located in the heart of the Al Bastakiya district, in the old city, the Orient Guest House seems suspended in time. Nearby, old houses and badgirs or traditional 'wind towers', contrast with modern buildings that have sprung up throughout the rest of Dubai. In contrast, authenticity is to be found here in every nook of the establishment.

Each of the ten rooms has traditional Arab furniture: beautiful wooden beds, colourful curtains and, on the floor, Persian rugs. You will be charmed by the outdoor courtyard. Sit for a moment on the bench, let yourself be rocked by the water flowing from the small fountain and the faint sounds of the city heard from beyond the high white walls. Always attentive to your needs, the Orient Guest House team will gladly point the way to the Meena Bazaar or the Dubai Museum.

Orient Guest House
Al Fahidi Street
Bastakiya Area
P.O. Box 46500, Dubai

+971 (0)4 351 9111

https://www.heritagedubaihotels.com/hotel-orient-guest-house-in-dubai/

Rooms: from 201 AED

content.title: Pure sophistication at STAY

introduction.small: A culinary journey between France and the Emirates, STAY offers modern cuisine by Yannick Alléno.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Pure sophistication at STAY

paragraphs.text:
A Michelin three-starred chef, Yannick Alléno makes the heart of French cooking thrive around the world in his restaurants' cuisine. Among them, STAY in Dubai offers you the chance to savour a subtle blend of French and Middle Eastern flavours. The fillet of veal is topped with truffle juice, when the whole sea bass is accompanied with grilled eggplant and ground mushrooms and serves two. For dessert, opt for a “Mètre Pâtissier” (or “Half Metre” for the more reasonable), a sculpted pastry ribbon inspired by dressmakers measuring tapes.

In the centre of the room, the 'pastry library' invites you to indulge your sweet tooth by elevating pastries to the rank of masterpiece. And if the menu has seduced you, the view of the illuminated pool of One&Only The Palm hotel will charm you even more.

STAY by Yannick Alléno
The One&Only The Palm
West Crescent
Palm Jumeirah
P.O. Box 114843, Dubai

+971 (0)4 440 1030

www.yannick-alleno.com/en/restaurants-reservation/alleno/restaurant-dubai.html

Menu: around 290 AED

content.title: A beautiful escape above Dubai's skyscrapers

introduction.small: From the azure sky of Dubai, take the time to admire the whimsical landscapes of this artificial island, comfortably seated in a seaplane.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: A beautiful escape above Dubai's skyscrapers

paragraphs.text:
Start your flight in the clear waters of the Persian Gulf. A 30-minute trip in the air awaits you above and beyond the city's emblematic sites, such as the islands of Palm Jumeirah, The World, the famous Burj Khalifa skyscraper or the unique Dubai Marina. Dubai is even more extravagant than in your imagination: "modernity", "gigantism" and "madness" are the most appropriate terms to describe the most famous city in the United Arab Emirates. Observe the city from the air, during a surrealist moment, and discover a new perspective of the city. Grant yourself the chance to try the unique experience of flying in a seaplane. You are no longer an infinitesimal being at the foot of Dubai's skyscrapers, but instead a spectator of the perpetual ant ballet beneath you.

Meeting point
The Dubai Creek Golf & Yacht Club
Baniyas Road
Port Saeed
Dubai

+971 (0)4 807 0708

https://seawings.ae/

content.title: Dubai's crazy heights

introduction.small: Your heart is beating full speed ahead. Under your feet, the city spreads out its high rises on the edge of the Persian Gulf. Ready for a leap into the air?

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Dubai's crazy heights

paragraphs.text:
Dubai, an artificial island of more than three million inhabitants, is considered one of the most beautiful skydiving destinations in the world and can make thrill seekers dream. After you meet your instructor with an appropriately impressive professional background, you are ready to launch into a dizzying 55-second freefall at a speed of 200 km/h. Are you ready?

As you climb to over 4,000 metres in altitude in a small plane, you are already flying over the metropolis and its hundreds of skyscrapers in the middle of the desert, its teeming shopping centres around Khor Dubai, and the striking flock of islands of the Palm Jumeirah and The World archipelagos. Arms crossed on your torso, you let yourself leap from the airplane and fall into the void. You feel free, alive. Once the parachute is wide open, you will be able to admire the city and its architectural wonders, prey to delusions of grandeur.

Skydive Dubai
Al Seyahi Street
Dubai

+971 (0)4 377 8888

https://www.skydivedubai.ae/

content.title: Ibis Styles Dragon Mart, for business and pleasure

introduction.small: Two steps away from the International City, this Ibis group hotel allows you to stay in Dubai in a designer-hotel room... on the cheap.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Ibis Styles Dragon Mart, for business and pleasure

paragraphs.text:
Finding a hotel in Dubai at a reasonable price can be a headache. Thankfully, the Accor chain offers this new establishment in its 'economy' range. The contemporary design and bright colours make it the perfect address if you are visiting for business or on vacation with the family. Whether a single room or a 'connecting double', the system easily adapts to all needs. Each room follows the Sweet Bed concept - infinitely soft bedding, anti-noise walls, free Wi-Fi, and everything needed to prepare a cup of tea or coffee. The bar and restaurant can provide a quick lunch, a traditional dish, or a full-on gastronomic feast.

Ibis Styles Dragon Mart
Al Awir Road E44 on Hatta Road

content.title: Massimo, “il delizioso”

introduction.small: A spectacular and very authentic trattoria run by two Italian brothers in the heart of Marina, with a fabulous waterfront terrace.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Massimo, “il delizioso”

paragraphs.text:
Don't be fooled by the size and location: this is not a tourist trap like so many other places in this area, but a real and very authentic Italian restaurant. The two brothers, Massimo and Franco, serve the best pasta and pizza in town. Almost all the ingredients are imported from Italy - the mozzarella, burrata, and flour, even the tomatoes. The pizza dough rests for up to 36 hours and the crusts are light, chewy, and crisp, while main dishes are prepared just the way mamma made them. So forget the decor, which is hardly that of a Sicilian trattoria, grab a table on the large terrace, enjoy the breathtaking view, and tuck in.

Massimo
Park Island
Waterfront
Dubai Marina

+971 (0)800 2426

https://massimos.ae/

Menu: around 100 AED

content.title: The Bab al Shams: a luxurious retreat in the desert

introduction.small: This oasis of exoticism and calm is installed in an ancient Arab fort at a reasonable distance from Dubai.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: The Bab al Shams: a luxurious retreat in the desert

paragraphs.text:
After crossing the dunes for 45 minutes, the silhouette of the Bab Al Shams stands out on the horizon like a mirage. It emerges from the sand, like the most isolated traditional Arab villages.

At the heart of this luxury hotel, 115 rooms and suites are beautifully decorated in the style of the Persian Gulf. Refined precious wood and ceramic tiles are the preferred materials. Each room has a pleasant view of the desert, the courtyard, or the garden, and some even feature balconies or patios. The hotel is a welcome retreat to enjoy the pleasures of the desert. It offers a variety of activities such as excursions on a camel, demonstrations of hawk training, and performances of traditional dance. As for its services, you will enjoy cooling off in the pool, where a waterfall has been constructed, or having a massage by the Satori Spa masseuses in a tent.

At sunset, go up on the roof terrace to enjoy a moment of serenity . For meals, you can choose from seven bars and restaurants of several different cuisines (Arabic, Indian, Italian, International), but do not miss the Al Hadheerah, where you can sample traditional dishes under the open sky. A children's club will relieve parents so they can take in the best of this exceptional five-star paradise.

Bab Al Shams Desert Resort& Spa
Al Qudra Road
P.O. Box 8168, Dubai

+971 (0)4 809 6100

https://babalshams.com/

Rooms: from 850 AED

content.title: Around the world in the Ibn Battuta mall

introduction.small: Visit this commercial centre whose decoration is inspired by Ibn Battuta, a major Arab explorer.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Around the world in the Ibn Battuta mall

paragraphs.text:
With nearly 100 shopping centres in town, the competition is fierce, so the proprietors use their imagination to compete for visitors. This one chose to take Ibn Battuta as the common thread.

This great Arab explorer is considered the Marco Polo of the Middle East. To celebrate his 30 years of travels and travel narratives, the place is divided into six different geographic areas that let the visitor go from China to India via Egypt, Persia, Andalusia, and Tunisia. Go back in time admiring the beautiful shop fronts from another era. More than 400 stores are spread in six pavilions, where you can find such large retailers as Deben hams, the famous Sharaf DG store dedicated to electronics, and Paris Gallery, for perfumes.

You can also enjoy a cinema complex with 21 theatres and the first Imax screen in the region. Even if you have no intention of going shopping, visiting this unique setting is worth the trip.

Ibn Battuta Mall
Sheikh Zayed Road
P.O. Box 261177, Dubai
Jebel Ali

+971 (0)4 362 1900

https://www.ibnbattutamall.com/en

content.title: Run camels run!

introduction.small: One of a kind, a camel race is an unforgettable moment for visitors to the region.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Run camels run!

paragraphs.text:
Imagine camels running off at 40 km/h, one after another, and a host of Emiratis screaming the names of their favourites as they go! It is quite unthinkable to leave Dubai without having seen a genuine camel race, the national sport of the Emirates. These are very serious competitions in the region, as important as the races at Long champ or Ascot.

Be aware that, although we often speak of camels, they are actually dromedaries. Note too that the animals are not ridden by human jockeys, but by little robot jockeys who have, thankfully, replaced the very young children who used to do the job. Races are held every Friday morning at the Dubai Camel Racing Club in the desert, 60 kilometres from the city. Seasons last from October or November through February or March, and the races are run between 7:00 a.m. and early afternoon.

Check with your hotel front desk for more information on programming because there are frequent changes. Admission is free and betting is strictly forbidden.

Dubai Camel Racing Club
Dubai-Al Ain Road
Al Marmoum

+971 (0)4 832 6526

https://www.dubaicrc.ae/en

content.title: Cruise Dubai Creek on a traditional boat

introduction.small: Float down the water on a wooden ‘abra', a tribute to slowness.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Cruise Dubai Creek on a traditional boat

paragraphs.text:
Seeing a city from the water gives you a different perspective on it, and when it comes to Dubai, it makes its skyline and its majestic towers all the more impressive.

You will have the opportunity to take an abra, a wooden water taxi, to get around, especially between the souks and the old town. For a few dirhams, you will have stunning views of the skyscrapers and a beautiful look at daily life in this out of the ordinary city. Many residents of all nationalities use these boats every day to get to work, to shop, or to go out for a drink. It's a more popular means of transport than the subway!

If you find the travel time too short, you can rent an abra by the hour to sail among the most beautiful sailboats or yachts that dock in the marina. Go out on the water at sunset, when the call to prayers echoing in the minarets transports you to the Dubai of yesteryear.

content.title: Make the most of the Talise Spa

introduction.small: This Ottoman Spa, in the Jumeirah commercial centre, is a true oasis dedicated to wellness.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Make the most of the Talise Spa

paragraphs.text:
After having spent the day shopping in the luxurious complex of Madinat Jumeirah that resembles a traditional souk, enjoy a break in this wonderful Spa, located within the Al Qasr hotel. The spa seems to emerge out of nowhere, as if it is lost inside a lush tropical garden.

Inside, contemporary comfort and oriental charm meet. The 26 cabins allow you to enjoy various treatments, such as massages and facials, in your own private cocoon. Know that you can enjoy treatments as a couple, too, if you wish. A swimming pool, infrared sauna, relaxation areas, hammam, and restaurant complete the space.

The establishment also offers yoga classes in the beautiful garden and provides a holistic experience to deeply rejuvenate in the Alpha Sphere DELUXE. A true escape in the heart of the city, the Talise Spa perfectly blends luxury and relaxation.

Talise Spa
Jumeirah Al Sufouh 1
Madinat Jumeirah
P.O. Box 75157, Dubai
Al Sufouh

+971 (0)4 366 6818

https://www.jumeirah.com/en/jumeirah-group/portfolio/talise/

content.title: Explore the largest golf courses

introduction.small: Greens fans, you will have more than one occasion to golf in the Gulf.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Explore the largest golf courses

paragraphs.text:
Dubai boasts some of the finest golf courses in the United Arab Emirates. Jumeirah Golf Estates hosts world-renowned competitions. Separated into two parts 'earth' and 'fire' this course, designed by champion Greg Norman, is challenging for even the most experienced players.

Equally impressive, the Emirates Golf Club hosts the annual Omega Dubai Desert Classic and the women's tournament, the Dubai Ladies' Masters, which has the peculiarity of promoting a very particular form of nightclubbing: golfing at night under artificial lights!

Also note that golfing legend Nick Faldo has designed a course here. The Address Montgomerie Dubai Golf Club, in turn, is one of the most exclusive and demanding of clubs; it is part of the very upscale Emirates Hills Properties. Its absolutely breathtaking driving range has several training greens and a golf-swing analysis studio to improve your technique.

Jumeirah Golf Estate Clubhouse
Shaikh Mohammed Bin Zaved Road
P.O. BOX 644877
Dubai

+971 (0)4 818 2000

https://www.jumeirahgolfestates.com/

content.title: Ski Dubai: winter sports in summertime

introduction.small: A ski area in the desert? Only in Dubai could one dream up such infrastructure, in a shopping centre no less.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Ski Dubai: winter sports in summertime

paragraphs.text:
Upon its opening at the famous Mall of the Emirates in 2005, this ski area was taken as an ephemeral delirium. And yet it continues to attract thousands of people every day, who come to enjoy the artificial snow for downhill skiing, snowboarding, or bobsledding. The 22,500 sqm of snow on five trails enable skiers of all levels to satisfy their desires for 'coolness'. For small children, a snow park of 3,000 sqm, with caves and tobogganing, is available. Like any self-respecting ski area, its mountaintop chalet, the Avalanche café, allows you to stop for a hot chocolate.

And for some other frosted sensations, head to Snow Bullet, a 16-metre-high zip-line, which will propel you above the trails. Apart from hats and gloves, all equipment is included in the entry price.

Prepare to give the best of yourself, as a large bay window allows visitors to observe your performance and also admire the little penguin colony.

Ski Dubai
Mall of the Emirates
Sheikh Zayed Road
P.O. Box 60811, Dubai
Al Barsha South 1

+971 (0)4 409 4090

https://www.skidxb.com/

content.title: At.Mosphere: a must-see restaurant for dinner at the top

introduction.small: A magic panorama over Dubai in the highest restaurant in the world.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: At.Mosphere: a must-see restaurant for dinner at the top

paragraphs.text:
On the 122nd floor of the Burj Khalifa, the world's tallest skyscraper, the At.Mosphere bar gives you the exhilarating sensation of flying over Dubai. It is accessed via a futuristic elevator that propels you to 442 metres in record time. The doors then open onto a contemporary lounge bar where mahogany woodwork and brown leather armchairs sit alongside huge windows. In the distance, you can even see the desert and the dazzling spectacle of the Dubai fountains. You will be mesmerised by the spectacular views to be enjoyed while tasting delicacies made by chef Yann Meinsel's team, which highlight such delicacies as crispy chicken supreme and fried polenta, Australian beef in foie gras or cod and caviar. The lounge also offers a bistro menu, that is less elaborate but equally appetising. You can also go to the bar in the late afternoon to enjoy the sunset over the Arabian Sea around an afternoon tea, a snack or a cocktail. A unique experience.

At.Mosphere
Burj Khalifa
1 Mohammed Bin Rashid Boulevard
P.O. Box 9440, Dubai
Downtown

+971 (0)4 888 3828

www.atmosphereburjkhalifa.com

content.title: Test the creativity of Zuma

introduction.small: A trendy and refined Japanese restaurant in pure ‘Izakaya' tradition.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Test the creativity of Zuma

paragraphs.text:
Having won many awards, this is a real institution. In the heart of Dubai's business district, Zuma is a sophisticated and glamorous restaurant designed in the traditional style of a Japanese Izakaya.

The architect Noriyoshi Muramatsu has tested the harmony of the elements with a spectacular bamboo sculpture and walls of rusted steel. The cuisine has the same mix of textures. Zuma offers fusion cuisine inspired by Japanese and Californian styles. Creativity is at its height in the miso-marinated black cod rolled in magnolia leaves, Wagyu beef sushi in caviar and avocado ginger tempura.

Sit at the hand-carved granite bar to enjoy the stunning work of the cooks. Do not miss the superb Asian cocktails that are among the best in Dubai. As popular at lunchtime as at dinner, reservations are essential.

Zuma

P.O. Box 506620, Dubai
Financial Center

+971 (0)4 425 5660

https://zumarestaurant.com/

content.title: Stroll among the souks

introduction.small: Shopping destination par excellence, Dubai still has some picturesque traditional souks in the shadows of the supermalls.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Stroll among the souks

paragraphs.text:
In the historical part of the city, where the creek meets the sea, the Deira markets offer a different face of Dubai. Less modern, and swarming with people, the souks make the city feel more human and even endearing; they offer you an insight into the Middle East of yesteryear.

Let yourself be carried away by the smell of lemons, roses, cinnamon sticks, and other mixtures for the kitchen at the spice souk on Sikkat Al Khail street. You can get your fill of all kinds of Arab, Indian, and Asian spices and even different flavours of shisha tobacco, all sold by weight. The Gold Souk will amaze you with its many bracelets, necklaces, and earrings all shining like a thousand lights and presented in a simple building with a wooden roof. Less spectacular, the Naïf souk mean while sells a bit of everything: electronics, appliances, traditional clothing, and counterfeit goods of all kinds.

If you are not faint at heart, you can also check out the fish market, particularly lively in the early morning, when the fishermen land their catch of the night.

content.title: Umm Suqeim: Make the most of the public beach

introduction.small: Free and very well located, this downtown beach is never empty.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Umm Suqeim: Make the most of the public beach

paragraphs.text:
With an average temperature of 32ºC, the seaside of Dubai makes it a prime destination on the Persian Gulf. Its white sand, crystal-clear water and palm trees mean it need not envy the beaches of Miami or Tel Aviv.

Umm Suqeim, also known under the name of Sunset Beach, is a popular spot to indulge in idleness. No wonder. It is one of the cleanest and most picturesque public beaches in Dubai, ideally located next to the luxurious Madinat Jumeirah complex and the iconic Burj Al Arab. It is also one of the best surf spots in the city fans come to conquer the beautiful waves at dawn.

This beach is particularly popular with tourists and expats, so come early to put your towel in the best location, or stroll by in the evening to enjoy the beautiful romantic sunset over the Burj Al Arab.

content.title: Burj Khalifa, way above the city

introduction.small: Admire the view from Dubai's tallest building.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Burj Khalifa, way above the city

paragraphs.text:
Here at the tallest building in the world, the famous Burj Khalifa that rises to 828 metres high, you will, of course, have a breath-taking view over Dubai.

Be aware that the city is often hidden by fog, a characteristic that results more from chronic pollution than sandstorms. Within the building, you have several options to choose from. On the 148th floor, the observation platform called At the Top Burj Khalifa Sky is perched at 555 metres. It offers incredible 360-degree views of the extraordinary city. Another platform is accessible on the 125th floor at 456 metres above the ground. (Reserve tickets online in advance).

You can also enjoy the sunset at the At.Mosphere Lounge bar on the 122nd floor, where the view provides the heady sensation of dominating the world. A futuristic elevator accesses all of the observation decks and the bar. Not as high, but equally iconic, the beautiful Burj Al Arab deploys its graceful silhouette like a boat sailing on Jumeirah Beach and also has a panoramic view from the 27th floor, at the Sky view bar.

But more than a beach club, Nikki Beach is a genuine resort, with 117 rooms, 15 luxury villas and 63 residences. content.title: Get ready for the Dubai Shopping Festival

introduction.small: Make the most of monster sales in one of the largest temples of consumption in the world.

paragraphs.text:
Shopping is one of the favourite pastimes of UAE citizens and tourists visiting Dubai.

The city has witnessed the rapid multiplication of shopping centres, each one more attractive than the next, in which you can find absolutely everything you could possibly need, and then some. The high point of this buying spree is the Dubai Shopping Festival (DSF) which has taken place every January since 1995. This international event happens not only in the outsized malls that characterize the city, but also in the Oriental souks.

Massive discounts are offered on everything from automobiles, fashion, and carpets to electronic equipment, cosmetics, and computers. It's more than enough to turn the head of the most reasonable buyers, and it makes it nearly impossible to resist temptation. In addition to these unprecedented sales, there are concerts, lotteries, fashion shows, fireworks, and musical and artistic performances organised during this shopping festival.

content.title: Bird watching in the Ras Al Khor Wildlife Sanctuary

introduction.small: An important migratory stopping point between Africa and Asia, this reserve allows you to contemplate tens of thousands of birds.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Bird watching in the Ras Al Khor Wildlife Sanctuary

paragraphs.text:
Not far from the gleaming towers of Dubai, the nature reserve of Ras Al Khor spreads out over 1,300 hectares made up of salt deserts, intertidal mudflats, mangroves, and lagoons wild habitat for tens of thousands of migratory birds.

Literally 'cape of the creek', Ras Al Khor is located at the entrance of Dubai Creek and is one of the few urban protected areas in the world. This reserve is even the first site in the UAE to be included on the Ramsar List, which notes wetlands of international importance. Bird watchers can admire the birds from three different observation posts.

More than 500 pink flamingos were counted in the last census: egrets, grey herons, cormorants, black-winged stilts, sandpipers, ospreys and marsh harriers… This exceptional environment hosts more than 20,000 water birds, and a total of 67 species stop here on the migratory route from East Africa to West Asia. The entrance to this UNESCO-listed site is free.

content.title: Bur Dubai: the historical centre of the city

introduction.small: Nothing better than a walk through the old quarter of Dubai to rediscover the Oriental essence of the city.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Bur Dubai: the historical centre of the city

paragraphs.text:
Bur Dubai, the traditional district of the city once inhabited by Bedouins and fishermen, is nestled west of the Dubai Creek.

Start your walk at the historical heart of Shindagha and visit the palace of Sheikh Saeed, former residence of the Maktoum family, the dynasty that founded the city in the 19th century and still leads this small state, which has been part of the United Arab Emirates since 1971.

Then head to Bastakiya, the old commercial centre that has been impeccably restored. Persian merchants once settled here in traditional houses topped with windcatchers that were used in the 19th century to ventilate the interior.

Then walk through the various souks of Deira on the banks of the creek for an immersion in the Oriental world of yesteryear that will let you forget skyscrapers and artificial islands for a moment.

Finish the visit at the old Al Fahidi Fort, where you will find the Dubai Museum, which successfully illustrates the various phases of the city's development.

content.title: Safari: explore the sand, up close and personal

introduction.small: Make the desert your destination and leave the noisy city far behind.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Safari: explore the sand, up close and personal

paragraphs.text:
A drastic change of scenery is available just outside of Dubai, only a 45-minute drive from the city centre. Leaving the urban area, you will quickly arrive in the desert. Here you can sail the golden dunes aboard a 4x4 or buggy and enjoy the vastness and tranquillity of sandy landscapes. Need a thrill? Many tour companies will improvise a little session of ‘dune-bashing': accelerations, decelerations, and cornering twists worthy of the best amusement parks.

For the even more daring, a quad adventure, camel riding, biking, and surfing on the dunes provide an additional adrenaline charge. For a more calm and elegant visit, opt for the Platinum Heritage Luxury Tours that let you ride about in vintage Land Rovers or on mountain bikes with fat tires to scale the dunes. Later take a short rest to recover from your emotions, and then sip a mint tea while gazing at the sunset or try the shisha, an Oriental pipe, before enjoying a Bedouin dinner under the stars.

Ask your hotel concierge about the various tour packages on offer. Some even arrange the opportunity to bivouac in the desert for a night or more.

As four polo fields frame the hotel, you will be able to see the games from your room during the season. Riders, whether they are beginners or experienced, will appreciate being able to ride some of the horses from the club's stables.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Em Sherif: luxurious Lebanese cuisine

In Beirut, the Mireille Hayek restaurant is an institution. For its installation in Dubai, she chose the heart of downtown, at the foot of the hotel The Address, opposite the Burj Khalifa and the large fountain. Sit out on the lovely terrace to enjoy the view of these Dubai jewels. Inside, the enchanting decor is dominated by blue, with stylish black-and-white tile flooring. Mirror tables and velvet chairs are accessorised by luxurious Middle Eastern details.

Em Sherif takes the concept that has made it successful in Lebanon: no menu, just one formula of many dishes to be shared by all. The waiters twirl between tables to drop off a string of mezze (hummus, tabbouleh, fatayers, manakish, baba ghanoush, dolma).

Then come the grilled meats (kefta, shishtaouk, shawarma) and, finally, if you still have room, taste the tamriyye and maamoul bi jebneh. With traditional Lebanese songs playing in the background, you will feel that you've flown across the Persian Gulf.

Feel free to borrow an abra, a traditional wooden water taxi, from where you can admire the architecture and its beautiful windcatchers.

Many restaurants and bars line the waterways, havens for a break after shopping. Dominated by the elegant silhouette of the Burj Al-Arab and surrounded by canals, which earned it the nickname the 'Venice of the Middle East', this luxurious yet tasteful mall becomes magical at dusk.

A line of 220 boxes of different colours was placed along Jumeirah's Al Wasl Road, covering about 1,200 metres. This new kind of shopping centre is a big novelty in Dubai, where shopping in the open air is nearly impossible.

Alongside the 40 or so world-class stores such as Swatch, Toms, Marimekko, Adidas, Nike, and OnePiece, there are many restaurants, cafés, and terraces overlooking Burj Khalifa and the Dubai skyline. The place is especially nice at night. You can taste a wide variety of foods: burgers at Big Smoke, Italian dishes at Bianca , ice cream at Dri Dri, local dishes with modern flair at Log ma, or even a fondue (cheese or chocolate!) at Melting Pot.

content.title: Quite an altitude at 40 Kong

introduction.small: Be enchanted by this lounge high up in the air.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Quite an altitude at 40 Kong

paragraphs.text:
If bars and restaurants at high altitudes abound in Dubai, this one seduces with its modern, stylish rooftop terrace that lets you dine or enjoy a drink outdoors. Located on the 40th floor of the H hotel, it overlooks Sheikh Zayed Road. With white bar stools and wooden chairs with impeccable curves, the decor is decidedly design. The lamps are inspired by urban motifs, and the amber light provides a warm atmosphere.

The property remains a proper lounge until 11:00 p.m., when the DJ at the turntables increases the decibels to get people dancing. Opened in 2014, the 40 Kong soon became a must for trendy expatriates.

The place is popular for a drink, but you can also book a table for dinner. You will then have the choice of many dishes, ranging from Wiener schnitzel to salmon teriyaki.

content.title: Grosvenor House: classic charm in a modern building

introduction.small: This elegant establishment from the Marriott group is located in twin towers not far from the marina.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Grosvenor House: classic charm in a modern building

paragraphs.text:
Located in the trendy Marina District, Grosvenor House is divided between two towers of 45 floors. This iconic building with a stunning design evokes space shuttles pointed skyward. With their panoramic views of the Arabian Gulf and the Dubai Marina, the 750 suites and apartments are models of contemporary elegance and technology, maintained by an affable and attentive staff. With a conference room on location, the hotel is ideal for business guests, while all luxury lovers will appreciate its designer atmosphere and impeccable service. The Grosvenor House is home to Indego by Vineet, an Indian restaurant by starred chef Vineet Bhatia, the Rhodes W1 restaurant, run by Gary Rhodes, and the famous Buddha-Bar, mecca of Dubai nights. The hotel offers an enchanting Spa and free access to beaches and pools at the Royal Meridien, five minutes away on a free shuttle.

content.title: Savour Inca cuisine at Coya

introduction.small: For its Middle Eastern branch, the famous Peruvian restaurant chose the Four Seasons.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Savour Inca cuisine at Coya

paragraphs.text:
Once inside the front door here, you will discover a world of Andean culture. Wooden floors, soft cushions, walls covered with wood and metal, not to mention numerous statues and mystical details, all recall Peru.

The restaurant is divided into four spaces: the terrace, the Ceviche counter, the brass grill, and the main restaurant. The delicious cuisine obviously gives pride of place to ceviche, the marinated raw fish that is an icon of Peruvian cooking, but it also features anticuchos, grilled meats, and fish specialties. At the Pisco bar, the servers will be delighted to let you taste the legendary Latin American cocktail, the Pisco Sour.

This Andean atmosphere brings a note of exoticism to your visit and will delight those wishing for a getaway to a world far removed from the atmosphere of the souks and pristine beaches. It's a great change of scenery.

content.title: Shopping marathon at Dubai Mall

introduction.small: Give in to Dubai's favourite sport: shopping.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Shopping marathon at Dubai Mall

paragraphs.text:
Indulge in a shopping day at what, at 800,000 square metres, is not only the biggest mall in the Emirates, but also the largest mall in the world. The Dubai Mall is a super-centre shopping mall on an artificial lake in the shadow of the towering Burj Khalifa, where 1,300 shops sell just about everything you can think of. Major international brands have their shops here, but all price ranges are present.

You can go from Dior, Armani, and J.M. Weston to Forever 21 and Promod in minutes. But this is not just a mall. The Dubai Mall is based on what North Americans call 'shoppertainment': it combines shopping and leisure. Here you'll find a children's theme park, KidZania, an aquarium, an ice rink and even a VR Park!

Obviously, numerous restaurants, cafés, and even hotels are here to keep you fuelled up on your day out.
